name: Joseph Uhrich
text: Considerate service.  Friendly waitress who knew the menu items and could and wanted to help.  Decent beers and mixed drinks.  Small house salad easily feed's two.  The 2 wings and meatball sampler was earnestly offered and was free.  Good â€¦More

name: Alaska Ramone
text: Excellent Service. Excellent Pizza. Fresh, Crispy and Tasty. Wonderful manager. Very nice rewards club at no charge! I canâ€™t wait to go back and try other specialty pizzas. Strongly recommended.

name: Roselle Agosto
text: What a wonderful meal at Anthonyâ€™s Coal Fire Pizza! We stubbled  to this place just by chance and it closed at 9pm on a Sunday. They were super nice and accomodating. They didnâ€™t rush us or anything even though they were closing at 10pm. â€¦More

name: Ty Holtsclaw
text: Great spot !! Pizza was gorgeous & tasty !! The bartender too!! lol I got lucky and hit it late right b4 closing & almost had the place to myself. The staff was super friendly and provided excellent service. That PIZZA tho !!!

name: Shelby S
text:
Hungry after a round of golf, we saw pizza and thought why not? I am so glad we did. Michelle our server/bartender was amazing.
The portions are definitely large enough for 2 to share but if you get your own, â€¦More

name: Justin Kawa
text: In the realm of casual restaurant reviews this place is as good as it gets. The Italian sausage and pepper pizza is nice and spicy and a perfect compliment to a more simple option like the cheese pizza. Meatballs are dense and flavorful and â€¦More

name: Nadia Martinez
text: Great quality food! Coal fired pizza is similar in taste and texture to brick oven style with the crunchy thin crust. All of their ingredients are fresh. I love the meatballs, ricotta, and sausage best. Ask for fresh basil to top your pizza. Staff and drinks are also spectacular.

name: artur stasiowski
text: Great atmosphere, excellent food, exceptional service. First time at this location and it was very memorable. About time a good coal fired pizza opened up in the suburbs. Danielle was really polite and made great food recommendations. For sure will come again.

name: Kyle Govert
text: Went here to celebrate my wife's birthday and it was fantastic. Service was excellent all night. We tried the wings and the pizza and they were both amazing. Good atmosphere, not too loud at all. We will definitely be going back again.

name: Mindaugas Balsevicius
text: Not sure how to say this, but I will as it happened. I put an order for 1 pie and for some reason they had same order x2. I said no I definitely ordered 1. So, Tina, ended up surprising me with a completely free pizza, after I paid, a â€¦More

name: Josh Caine
text: Excellent pizza! And the meatball and wing appetizers were great also. Nice selection of draft beers. Would definitly come back next time we are in the area.

name: Stephanie Kisler
text: This restaurant has AMAZING food! You must order the app with two meatballs. It comes with a dollop of cheese and the most wonderful soft flatbread I've ever had. The pizza is awesome too! Had a custom 10" pizza with baby meatballs and â€¦More

name: Nicole Dabros
text: The pizza was AMAZING! The staff were super kind to our little one and made her feel like a grown up. Highly recommend!

name: Adrienn Nelson
text: Went there tonight and it was a terrible experience. Place was dead. Food was not up to par. Been to Lombard location. Which is much better. If you can avoid this location. This is not the same place it was when it opened. Hopefully the other two Chicago area locations do not go down hill.

name: Eamon Polanski
text: You haven't had good pizza until you have been here. The crust is "well done" because it's wood fired. That's part of what makes Anthony's amazing. The crust is crisp but not burnt or dry. The toppings are simple but they have some great â€¦More

name: Charles Li
text: Can taste the fresh ingredients in every bite (not just the pizza).  My son loved the focaccia bread.  Very friendly and attentive staff.  Bright atmosphere and reasonable prices.  Solid addition to the area.

name: Angelo Cardinal
text: Not your average pizza joint, in fact not sure they have just plain old cheese and sausage.  That's not a knock against them at all,  it's just because everything else is so much better. We had the egg plant pizza and loved it, can't wait â€¦More

name: Patti Maska
text: We went for our birthday girls. The waitress gave us a sample of the meatballs with ricotta cheese... ummm, to die for! Don't eat it without the cheese, it turned tasty meatballs fantabulous meatballs. We had white pizza (no tomatoes for my â€¦More

name: Matatela Palma
text: Best Pizza ever!  I really like their thin crust pizza. They have a few options, I really like the arugula and eggplant.  This pizza reminds me of the pizza I had in Naples, Italy.  It was as close to real Italian pizza as you can get with out going to Italy.

name: Nikki
text: I always order take out and I love the food... but the last time I went I had to wait 20 minutes extra for my order. The manager kept saying itâ€™s coming right up and she kept lying to me. I finally asked another employee how much longer it â€¦More

name: Shmexyzombie
text: Went here once and the experience was amazing! The location is fantastically kept and holds that oven-kitchen feel. Tried the wings and got a pizza and me and my friend were in love! Recommending and returning to sit in this place when we have another chance!

name: Eduardo Rivera
text: Let me preface this by saying I have eaten at a few different Anthony's across time(all in Florida) and I would not be exaggerating by saying I have eaten it at least a hundred times in the past two years.  This is the only negative â€¦More

name: mahdi miri
text: Pizza is advertised as 'well done'. Crust has good flavor but was very dry. Pizza sauce is very good but our pizza came with very little sauce on it which didn't help the dry crust situation. Also tried the Philly cheese steak pizza okay. Same issue with the crust. This time no sauce AND the meat topping was very dry.

name: Michelle Miceli
text: Delightful atmosphere, great warm welcome & waitstaff . Amazing & delicious food!  Roasted cauliflower coal oven pizza...delectable!! Wings & Meatballs are a must try!ðŸ˜‹ Will definitely be back & w/ others.

name: Scott Trepac
text: Food was great! Karolina was our server, she was very friendly and took great care of us as well as handled our complicated order perfectly.

name: Dolores Zaplatosch
text: First time going and was pleasantly surprised!! Simple yet delicious!!!  Servicer was very very nice but a little slow with the service.

name: Nora Collins
text: Why did you get rid of happy hour?  My husband definitely do not frequent your restaurant since this stopped.

name: Omar Ihmoud
text: The flavor of the crust and the way it is cooked, a long with the way they arrange the vegetables and meats is enough to give you an addictions to go back!

name: roz michel
text: The food was great and the staff were very personable. The atmosphere was intimate. Great place to visit on a Saturday afternoon.ðŸ’•

name: Lisa Anderson
text: Love the food. Great specialty drinks, love the Sangria. The Pot of meatballs is awesome. Making our way through the menu everything has been delicious. Awesome friendly staff.

name: Theresa Burgos
text: When I visited Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza in Orland Park last Friday the experience was amazing. The food is very good, the environment was very cozy, the staff were very nice. I just didn't want to leave this pizza place. I highly â€¦More

name: Den C
text: Great pizza, terrific salads and appetizers, decent wine list.  Service has always been good.

name: Mallory O
text: The wings were cooked perfectly! The paper thin crust on the pizza was delicious too. Mmmm

name: Kathleen Jones
text: Nice waitstaff.  Delicious pizza. Nice thin crust and fresh ingredients. Small calzone was great for two to share.  We definitely will be regulars.

name: John Manning
text: Nice place go eat. Good prices good service. Will go back. NEW YORK PIZZA

name: Ken Wirth
text:
Food is 5 star, service was very good.
The reason for a 4 and not a 5.  Restrooms could be cleaner with supplies stocked up for your guests

name: lisa velez
text: Great food, atmosphere and service!

name: Soad Kareem
text: Great pizza and very friendly staff.

name: Jadallah Mustafa
text: Amazing experience!  Very tasty Coal Fired Pizza!! Very friendly and professional staff, highly recommended!

name: Raya Hajhawi
text: Amazing food. Cauliflower pizza &  Margarita  Pizza are to die for!!! Service was great. I would definitely go back there again!

name: Mike
text: First time there yesterday. Wings and margaritas were awesome. Then our pizza came out and I was disappointed.  The meatballs on it were ice cold and when I mentioned it to our server he apologized but didn't do anything to rectify the problem.

name: Ralph Fiore
text:
Pizza was good
Everything was done well service was friendly.

name: Tim Spratt
text: I would like to start by saying I have had pizza all over the country. I actually just returned from a trip to New York,  this Antonyâ€™s pizza in Orland was just horrible!!! It had no flavor, crust was soggy and dripping with grease. No â€¦More

name: Jeffrey Matson
text: Pizza is always good! Love the coal fired taste!

name: Jim F
text: So I reviewed this place several months ago.  My recent experience was poor and I  wonâ€™t be going back.  Ordered brocolli rabe with sausage.  When it arrived at our table, the rabe was literally ice cold.  Told our server and he brought it â€¦More

name: Tracy
text: First time here. Will be back many times. Joined the club. Best pizza

name: Rick Korallus
text: Great Pizza! Great service, great atmosphere and the prices are fair too!!

name: Donna Elsass
text: Best described as boutique pizza.  The whole experience was amazing.

name: Victoria Roberts
text: Pizza was terrible, yes coal fired but that was were the taste ended. Expensive pizza with cheap ingredients. Even the salad was done poorly. Donâ€™t waste your money here with Giordanoâ€™s and Louâ€™s down the street.

name: Perry Papadopoulos
text: Firat and foremost, the service is great here.  The management and staff really go out of their way to make you feel welcome   We're in Chicagoland area and there are a ton of great pizzerias in many spread out neighborhoods.  For the SW â€¦More

name: Stephen Castillo
text: Great food and selection of craft beer. Our server seemed a little less than thrilled to be there though.

name: jeannie. gassel
text: Love the meatballs here, but after driving 5 hours to pick up my to-go pots, they had never seen the coal oven and we're soggy and unsmoked!

name: Lisa Lechtenberg
text: Awesome service, amazing food and a great atmosphere on a Sunday night. Joshua at the bar made the experience top notch. A great addition to Orland Park.

name: Kathy Pawlik-Mora
text: Wasnt sure about the cauliflower pizza but it was delicious. Love the pizza crust they make and leftovers weren't too bad the next day. Big portion sizes

name: Andy Schrode
text: Food was good but have a coal aftertaste from being cooked in the coal fire

name: Vicki Callahan
text: Terrible wait staff.  Ordered for take home and took forever.  For no.e and food was cold.

name: Kimberly Bryant
text: Best pizza and wait staff!

name: Chris B.
text: I enjoy their pizza and love taking advantage of their specials, including the happy hour (5-7pm).

name: Rich C
text: The Coal Fired Pizza is a delicious twist on a Chicago style pizza - Coal Fired - Excellent crisp crust on every bite! The wings, meatballs and eggplant are all Delicious and you could make a meal out of these appetizers alone!!!.... â€¦More

text: Great service, and fantastic food!

name: Joel T
text: It's a chain. Don't let that fool you. The pizza is great and the meatballs rival homemade.

name: John
text: Cauliflower appetizer was surprisingly good. Chicken wings were awesome. Didn't care for the meatballs.

name: cheryl favorites
text: Lunch pizza came out quickly and tasted great! Staff was excellent!

name: Tim GabarÃ©e

name: Hanna Salem
